item.title: Employers lobby to keep health care prices transparent in hopes of containing costs
item.description: Donald Trump's first administration advanced rules forcing hospitals and insurers to reveal prices for medical services. Employers don't want to risk backtracking during Trump's second administration.

item.title: Biden set an ambitious new climate goal. Will it still matter under Trump?
item.description: The Biden administration set a new climate goal for the U.S. The White House argues states, cities and corporations will continue the work, even as Trump plans to exit the Paris climate agreement.

item.title: After losing VP bid, Walz searches for role in pushing back against Trump
item.description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz saw his national profile skyrocket when he became Vice President Harris' running mate. Now, he's back home figuring out when he will push back or work with Republicans.

item.title: How the Assads used a civil war to turn Syria into a narco state
item.description: As Syria's economy collapsed during its civil war, the country became something of a narco state. The regime of ousted President Bashar al-Assad earned billions by trafficking in the drug Captagon.

item.title: Dozens of men are found guilty of raping a woman in France who was drugged to sleep
item.description: A French court found dozens of men guilty of raping a woman whose then-husband had drugged her unconscious over the course of a decade. The court sentenced the husband to a maximum 20 years in prison.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: France's highest court upholds corruption conviction of ex-President Nicolas Sarkozy
item.description: Sarkozy, 69, faces a year in prison, but is expected to ask to be detained at home with an electronic bracelet — as is the case for any sentence of two years or less.

item.title: About 3 dozen high-rise buildings in South Florida are sinking, a study finds
item.description: The 35 buildings surveyed along an almost 12-mile stretch from Miami Beach to Sunny Isles Beach have sunk or settled by 0.8 to 3.1 inches, scientists found.
